Definition: Five sentences comprise the story; write a title that relates to the story with a maximum of three words.

Positive Examples.input: Sentence 1: Melissa felt depressed during the winter. Sentence 2: She went to a therapist to discuss her problems. Sentence 3: The therapist suggested that she buy a sun lamp to help her. Sentence 4: She bought the lamp in hopes that it would help. Sentence 5: The lamp worked, so she no longer felt seasonal depression.
Positive Examples.explanation: Story talks about depressed Melissa during winter who visits a therapist to get rid of it.

Sentence 4: She said she wanted to know if he was grown up. Sentence 5: She said to tell me if he was grown her heart would be broken.

Sentence 1: I went to go buy a car. Sentence 2: I needed one that was fast. Sentence3: I was clueless. Sentence 4: A friend then gave me a car buying pamphlet. Sentence 5: Then, I was able to select a fast car.

Sentence 1: Charlie was trying to learn how to play baseball. Sentence 2: He wanted to learn the curve ball but couldn't get it down. Sentence3: Fortunately his dad knew baseball very well. Sentence 4: He started getting lessons from his dad. Sentence 5: The next week he tried out for the baseball team and made it!

Sentence 1: Cindy wanted her own puppy very much. Sentence 2: She asked her mother if she could have one. Sentence3: Her mother told her to save her money and work hard for one. Sentence 4: Cindy finally had saved up enough money with smart budgeting. Sentence 5: The next day she went to the pet store and got her puppy.

Sentence 1: Blair was surfing in the ocean. Sentence 2: He spotted a large fin in the water. Sentence3: He got very scared. Sentence 4: He paddled to the shore. Sentence 5: The shark swam away from the beach.
